      • showMessageDialog

        protected int showMessageDialog(java.awt.Component parent,
                                java.lang.String message,
                                java.lang.String title,
                                CcddConstants.DialogOption optionType,
                                javax.swing.Icon icon)
        Display a non-resizable, modal message dialog with the provided icon and return the button type selected
        Parameters:
        parent - window over which to center the dialog
        message - text message to display
        title - title to display in the dialog window frame
        optionType - dialog type: LOAD_OPTION, SAVE_OPTION, SEARCH_OPTION, READ_OPTION, PRINT_OPTION, CLOSE_OPTION, OK_OPTION, or OK_CANCEL_OPTION
        icon - icon to display to the left of the text message
        Returns:
        Selected button type

      • showMessageDialog

        protected int showMessageDialog(java.awt.Component parent,
                                java.lang.String message,
                                java.lang.String title,
                                int messageType,
                                CcddConstants.DialogOption optionType)
        Display a non-resizable, modal message dialog and return the button type selected. The icon displayed is based on the message type
        Parameters:
        parent - window over which to center the dialog
        message - text message to display
        title - title to display in the dialog window frame
        messageType - message type: JOptionPane.PLAIN_MESSAGE, JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE, JOptionPane.QUESTION_MESSAGE, JOptionPane.WARNING_MESSAGE, or JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE
        optionType - dialog type: LOAD_OPTION, SAVE_OPTION, SEARCH_OPTION, READ_OPTION, PRINT_OPTION, CLOSE_OPTION, OK_OPTION, or OK_CANCEL_OPTION
        Returns:
        Selected button type

      • showMessageDialog

        protected int showMessageDialog(java.awt.Component parent,
                                java.lang.String message,
                                java.lang.String title,
                                int messageType,
                                CcddConstants.DialogOption optionType,
                                boolean modal)
        Display a non-resizable message dialog and return the button type selected. The icon displayed is based on the message type. Dialog modality is based on the input flag
        Parameters:
        parent - window over which to center the dialog
        message - text message to display
        title - title to display in the dialog window frame
        messageType - message type: JOptionPane.PLAIN_MESSAGE, JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE, JOptionPane.QUESTION_MESSAGE, JOptionPane.WARNING_MESSAGE, or JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE
        optionType - dialog type: LOAD_OPTION, SAVE_OPTION, SEARCH_OPTION, READ_OPTION, PRINT_OPTION, CLOSE_OPTION, OK_OPTION, or OK_CANCEL_OPTION
        modal - false to allow the main application window to still be operated while the dialog is open
        Returns:
        Selected button type

      • showMessageDialog

        protected int showMessageDialog(java.awt.Component parent,
                                java.lang.String message,
                                javax.swing.JPanel buttonPnl,
                                javax.swing.JButton defaultBtn,
                                java.lang.String title,
                                int messageType)
        Display a non-resizable, modal message dialog using user-supplied buttons, and return the button type selected. The icon displayed is based on the message type
        Parameters:
        parent - window over which to center the dialog
        message - text message to display
        buttonPnl - panel containing the dialog buttons
        defaultBtn - reference to the JButton that is actuated if the Enter key is pressed; null to have no default button
        title - title to display in the dialog window frame
        messageType - message type: JOptionPane.PLAIN_MESSAGE, JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE, JOptionPane.QUESTION_MESSAGE, JOptionPane.WARNING_MESSAGE, or JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE
        Returns:
        Selected button type

      • showIgnoreCancelDialog

        protected int showIgnoreCancelDialog(java.awt.Component parent,
                                     java.lang.String message,
                                     java.lang.String title,
                                     java.lang.String ignoreToolTip,
                                     java.lang.String ignoreAllToolTip,
                                     java.lang.String cancelToolTip,
                                     boolean noIgnore)
        Create the Ignore/Ignore All/Cancel or Ignore All/Cancel dialog
        Parameters:
        parent - window over which to center the dialog
        message - text message to display
        title - title to display in the dialog window frame
        ignoreToolTip - Ignore button tool tip text; null if no tool tip is to be displayed
        ignoreAllToolTip - Ignore All button tool tip text; null if no tool tip is to be displayed
        cancelToolTip - Cancel button tool tip text; null if no tool tip is to be displayed
        noIgnore - true to not display the Ignore button
        Returns:
        Selected button type

        optionType - DialogOption type
        resizable - true to allow the dialog to be resized

      • choosePathFile

        protected CcddClassesComponent.FileEnvVar[] choosePathFile(CcddMain main,
                                                           java.awt.Component parent,
                                                           java.lang.String fileName,
                                                           java.lang.String fileType,
                                                           javax.swing.filechooser.FileNameExtensionFilter[] fileExtensions,
                                                           boolean multipleFiles,
                                                           java.lang.String dialogTitle,
                                                           java.lang.String folder,
                                                           CcddConstants.DialogOption optionType)
        Display a dialog that allows the user to select one or more files
        Parameters:
        main - main class
        parent - window over which to center the dialog
        fileName - file name to display in the input field chosen; null if no file name is initially displayed. Ignored if folderOnly is true
        fileType - describes the type of files when more than one file extension is supplied; null if only one (or no) file extension is provided. Ignored if folderOnly is true
        fileExtensions - valid file extensions with description. Use null to allow any extension. Ignored if folderOnly is true
        multipleFiles - true to allow selection of more than one file
        dialogTitle - title to display in the dialog window frame
        folder - file path to use as the initial folder to display
        optionType - dialog type: LOAD_OPTION, SAVE_OPTION, SEARCH_OPTION, READ_OPTION, PRINT_OPTION, CLOSE_OPTION, OK_OPTION, or OK_CANCEL_OPTION
        Returns:
        Array containing the selected file handle(s). null if the Cancel button is selected. The first file reference is null if Okay is selected and the file name list is empty

      • choosePathFile

        protected CcddClassesComponent.FileEnvVar[] choosePathFile(CcddMain main,
                                                           java.awt.Component parent,
                                                           java.lang.String dialogTitle,
                                                           java.lang.String folder,
                                                           CcddConstants.DialogOption optionType)
        Display a dialog that allows the user to select a file folder
        Parameters:
        main - main class
        parent - window over which to center the dialog
        dialogTitle - title to display in the dialog window frame
        folder - file path to use as the initial folder to display
        optionType - dialog type: LOAD_OPTION, SAVE_OPTION, SEARCH_OPTION, READ_OPTION, PRINT_OPTION, CLOSE_OPTION, OK_OPTION, or OK_CANCEL_OPTION
        Returns:
        Array containing the selected file handle(s). null if the Cancel button is selected. The first file reference is null if Okay is selected and the file name list is empty

      • choosePathFile

        protected CcddClassesComponent.FileEnvVar[] choosePathFile(CcddMain main,
                                                           java.awt.Component parent,
                                                           java.lang.String fileName,
                                                           java.lang.String fileType,
                                                           javax.swing.filechooser.FileNameExtensionFilter[] fileExtensions,
                                                           boolean folderOnly,
                                                           boolean multipleFiles,
                                                           java.lang.String dialogTitle,
                                                           java.lang.String folder,
                                                           CcddConstants.DialogOption optionType,
                                                           javax.swing.JPanel lowerPanel)
        Display a dialog that allows the user to select one or more files or a folder. Optionally allow a panel containing other components to be displayed beneath the file chooser portion
        Parameters:
        main - main class
        parent - window over which to center the dialog
        fileName - file name to display in the input field chosen; null if no file name is initially displayed. Ignored if folderOnly is true (may be null)
        fileType - describes the type of files when more than one file extension is supplied; null if only one (or no) file extension is provided. Ignored if folderOnly is true (may be null)
        fileExtensions - valid file extensions with description. Use null to allow any extension. Ignored if folderOnly is true (may be null)
        folderOnly - true to allow only folders to be selected
        multipleFiles - true to allow selection of more than one file. Unused if folderOnly is true
        dialogTitle - title to display in the dialog window frame
        folder - file path to use as the initial folder to display
        optionType - dialog type: LOAD_OPTION, SAVE_OPTION, SEARCH_OPTION, READ_OPTION, PRINT_OPTION, CLOSE_OPTION, OK_OPTION, or OK_CANCEL_OPTION
        lowerPanel - JPanel containing other components to display below the JChooser component; null if no lower components are to be displayed
        Returns:
        Array containing the selected file handle(s). null if the Cancel button is selected. The first file reference is null if Okay is selected and the file name list is empty

      • addRadioButtons

        protected boolean addRadioButtons(java.lang.String rbtnSelected,
                                  boolean canReselect,
                                  java.lang.String[][] itemInformation,
                                  java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> disabledItems,
                                  java.lang.String rbtnText,
                                  boolean isDescItalic,
                                  javax.swing.JPanel dialogPanel,
                                  java.awt.GridBagConstraints dialogGbc)
        Add radio buttons, representing the available selections from a supplied array, in a grid pattern to the dialog panel. Select and gray out the currently selected item if supplied
        Parameters:
        rbtnSelected - name of the initially selected item. null if no item is initially chosen
        canReselect - true if the initially selected item can be reselected; false to disable reselection of the initial item
        itemInformation - array of items from which to select. The first column is the item name and the second column is the item description
        disabledItems - list of indices for items that appear in the list but cannot be selected; null or empty list if no items are disabled
        rbtnText - text to display above the radio button panel
        isDescItalic - true to display the description text in the italic label font; false to use the plain label font
        dialogPanel - dialog panel on which to place the radio buttons
        dialogGbc - dialog panel GridBagLayout layout constraints
        Returns:
        true if there is one or more items to display; the dialog is populated with the array of radio buttons. false if there are no items to display; the dialog panel is unchanged

      • addCheckBoxes

        protected boolean addCheckBoxes(java.lang.String cboxSelected,
                                java.lang.String[][] itemInformation,
                                java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> disabledItems,
                                java.lang.String cboxText,
                                boolean isDescItalic,
                                javax.swing.JPanel dialogPanel)
        Add check boxes, representing the available selections from a supplied array, in a grid pattern to the dialog panel. Select and gray out the currently selected item if supplied
        Parameters:
        cboxSelected - name of the initially selected item. Null if no item is initially chosen. A protected item cannot be selected
        itemInformation - array of items from which to select. The first column is the item name and the second column is the item description
        disabledItems - list of indices for items that appear in the list but cannot be selected; null or empty list if no items are disabled
        cboxText - text to display above the check box panel
        isDescItalic - true to display the description text in the italic label font; false to use the plain label font
        dialogPanel - dialog panel on which to place the check boxes
        Returns:
        true if there is one or more items to display; the dialog is populated with the array of check boxes. false if there are no items to display; the dialog panel is unchanged

      • setButtonWidth

        protected void setButtonWidth()
        Extract the dialog's button(s) from the supplied panel, then find the widest button calculated from the button's text and icon. Set the width of the panel containing the buttons based on the widest button

        Set the number of rows occupied by the dialog's buttons
        Parameters:
        rows - number of dialog button rows

        Enable/disable the button panel buttons. Override to include other dialog controls
        Parameters:
        enable - true to enable the buttons; false to disable

      • createDialog

        protected int createDialog(java.awt.Component parent,
                           java.lang.Object upperObject,
                           javax.swing.JPanel buttonPnl,
                           javax.swing.JButton defaultBtn,
                           java.lang.String title,
                           CcddConstants.DialogOption optionType,
                           javax.swing.Icon icon,
                           boolean resizable,
                           boolean modal)
        Create the dialog. If no buttons are provided (lower panel) then create the buttons and button listeners needed based on the dialog type
        Parameters:
        parent - window over which to center the dialog; set to null to redirect message dialog text to the standard output stream (usually the command line)
        upperObject - object containing the dialog components or message
        buttonPnl - panel containing the dialog buttons
        defaultBtn - reference to the JButton that is actuated if the Enter key is pressed; null to have no default button
        title - title to display in the dialog window frame
        optionType - dialog type: LOAD_OPTION, SAVE_OPTION, SEARCH_OPTION, READ_OPTION, PRINT_OPTION, CLOSE_OPTION, OK_OPTION, or OK_CANCEL_OPTION
        icon - icon to display to the left of the text message
        resizable - true to allow the dialog to be resized
        modal - false to allow the other application windows to still be operated while the dialog is open
        Returns:
        Selected button type

      • isContainsComponent

        private <E> boolean isContainsComponent(java.awt.Container container,
                                        java.lang.Class<E> tgtClass)
        Check if the specified container or its children contains a component of the specified class. This is a recursive method
        Type Parameters:
        E - generic type parameter
        Parameters:
        container - container object in which to search
        tgtClass - target class for which to search
        Returns:
        true if the container contains an component of the specified class

      • setLocationRelativeTo

        public void setLocationRelativeTo(java.awt.Component comp)
        Override the setLocationRelativeTo() method so that the dialog can be positioned relative to a parent that was present, but is no longer visible. Otherwise, the dialog would be centered on the screen
        Overrides:
        setLocationRelativeTo in class java.awt.Window
        Parameters:
        comp - component in relation to which the dialog's location is determined

      • adjustDialogLocationForScreen

        protected static java.awt.Point adjustDialogLocationForScreen(java.awt.Rectangle comp)
        Set the component location so that it is completely inside the available screen(s), if possible. Although the method makes an effort to place the component so that it is entirely visible, it may end up partially outside the screen(s), either because it's larger than all available screens or the screens are arranged badly
        Parameters:
        comp - rectangle representing a component's bounds for which to adjust the location
        Returns:
        Point giving the x, y coordinates of the component adjusted to fit within the screen in which the component resides

      • positionInsideRectangle

        private static java.awt.Point positionInsideRectangle(java.awt.Rectangle comp,
                                                      java.awt.Rectangle screen)
        Adjust the location of the specified rectangular boundary such that it is within the specified rectangle representing the screen's bounds
        Parameters:
        comp - rectangle representing a component's bounds for which to adjust the location
        screen - bounding rectangle, representing a screen, that the component is to remain within
        Returns:
        Point giving the x, y coordinates of the component rectangle adjusted to fit within the specified screen's bounds

      • getScreenRectangles

        private static java.awt.Rectangle[] getScreenRectangles()
        Get the available display space as an array of rectangles (there is one rectangle for each screen; if the environment is headless the resulting array will be empty).
        Returns:
        Array of rectangles representing the bounds of the screen(s)
